page.title: 15Parkgate's Past Places
page.content: { Parkgate's Past Places} ************************ Parkgate has buildings of interest but some have now disappeared only to be used for more mundane purposes. {Swimming Baths}-were situated along from the Boathouse Restaurant.They were{popular after opening in 1923.}In 1930 a smaller children's pool was added.It was closed during the war, re-opened for five years and{closed in {1950.}The area is now part of the Wirral Country Park. {Convalescent Home}-now been{demolished to become a garage car-park.The home was{opened in 1882},became a holiday home for children of Liverpool after the 1st World War and evacuee children were housed there at the time of the 2nd World War
